This transaction kind is deprecated in favour of `EndOfEpochTransaction`.

types.name: DynamicField
types.description:
Dynamic fields are heterogenous fields that can be added or removed from an object at runtime. Their names are arbitrary Move values that have `copy`, `drop`, and `store`.

There are two sub-types of dynamic fields:

- Dynamic fields can store any value that has `store`. Objects stored in this kind of field will be considered wrapped (not accessible via its ID by external tools like explorers, wallets, etc. accessing storage).
- Dynamic object fields can only store objects (values that have the `key` ability, and an `id: UID` as its first field) that have `store`, but they will still be directly accessible off-chain via their ID after being attached as a field.

types.name: Epoch
types.description:
Activity on Sui is partitioned in time, into epochs.

Epoch changes are opportunities for the network to reconfigure itself (perform protocol or system package upgrades, or change the committee) and distribute staking rewards. The network aims to keep epochs roughly the same duration as each other.

During a particular epoch the following data is fixed:

- protocol version,
- reference gas price,
- system package versions,
- validators in the committee.

fields.name: epochId
fields.description: The epoch's id as a sequence number that starts at 0 and is incremented by one at every epoch change.

fields.name: checkpoints
fields.description: The epoch's corresponding checkpoints.

fields.name: coinDenyList
fields.description:
State of the Coin DenyList object (0x403) at the start of this epoch.

The DenyList controls access to Regulated Coins. Writes to the DenyList are accumulated and only take effect on the next epoch boundary. Consequently, it's possible to determine the state of the DenyList for a transaction by reading it at the start of the epoch the transaction is in.

fields.name: protocolConfigs
fields.description: The epoch's corresponding protocol configuration, including the feature flags and the configuration options.

fields.name: referenceGasPrice
fields.description: The minimum gas price that a quorum of validators are guaranteed to sign a transaction for in this epoch.

fields.name: startTimestamp
fields.description: The timestamp associated with the first checkpoint in the epoch.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description:
The transactions in this epoch, optionally filtered by transaction filters.

Returns `None` when no checkpoint is set in scope (e.g. execution scope).

fields.name: systemPackages
fields.description: The system packages used by all transactions in this epoch.

fields.name: endTimestamp
fields.description: The timestamp associated with the last checkpoint in the epoch (or `null` if the epoch has not finished yet).

fields.name: validatorSet
fields.description: Validator-related properties, including the active validators.

fields.name: totalCheckpoints
fields.description:
The total number of checkpoints in this epoch.

Returns `None` when no checkpoint is set in scope (e.g. execution scope).

fields.name: totalTransactions
fields.description: The total number of transaction blocks in this epoch (or `null` if the epoch has not finished yet).

fields.name: totalGasFees
fields.description: The total amount of gas fees (in MIST) that were paid in this epoch (or `null` if the epoch has not finished yet).

fields.name: totalStakeRewards
fields.description: The total MIST rewarded as stake (or `null` if the epoch has not finished yet).

fields.name: totalStakeSubsidies
fields.description: The amount added to total gas fees to make up the total stake rewards (or `null` if the epoch has not finished yet).

fields.name: fundSize
fields.description:
The storage fund available in this epoch (or `null` if the epoch has not finished yet).
This fund is used to redistribute storage fees from past transactions to future validators.

fields.name: netInflow
fields.description: The difference between the fund inflow and outflow, representing the net amount of storage fees accumulated in this epoch (or `null` if the epoch has not finished yet).

fields.name: fundInflow
fields.description: The storage fees paid for transactions executed during the epoch (or `null` if the epoch has not finished yet).

fields.name: fundOutflow
fields.description: The storage fee rebates paid to users who deleted the data associated with past transactions (or `null` if the epoch has not finished yet).

fields.name: storageFund
fields.description:
SUI set aside to account for objects stored on-chain, at the start of the epoch.
This is also used for storage rebates.

fields.name: safeMode
fields.description: Information about whether this epoch was started in safe mode, which happens if the full epoch change logic fails.

fields.name: systemStateVersion
fields.description:
The value of the `version` field of `0x5`, the `0x3::sui::SuiSystemState` object.
This version changes whenever the fields contained in the system state object (held in a dynamic field attached to `0x5`) change.

fields.name: systemParameters
fields.description: Details of the system that are decided during genesis.

fields.name: systemStakeSubsidy
fields.description: Parameters related to the subsidy that supplements staking rewards

fields.name: liveObjectSetDigest
fields.description:
A commitment by the committee at the end of epoch on the contents of the live object set at that time.
This can be used to verify state snapshots.

fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.name: eventBcs
fields.description:
The Base64 encoded BCS serialized bytes of the entire Event structure from sui-types.
This includes: package_id, transaction_module, sender, type, and contents (which itself contains the BCS-serialized Move struct data).

fields.name: sender
fields.description: Address of the sender of the transaction that emitted this event.

fields.name: sequenceNumber
fields.description: The position of the event among the events from the same transaction.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description:
Timestamp corresponding to the checkpoint this event's transaction was finalized in.
All events from the same transaction share the same timestamp.

`null` for simulated/executed transactions as they are not included in a checkpoint.

fields.name: transaction
fields.description: The transaction that emitted this event. This information is only available for events from indexed transactions, and not from transactions that have just been executed or dry-run.

fields.name: transactionModule
fields.description: The module containing the function that was called in the programmable transaction, that resulted in this event being emitted.

fields.description: The item at the end of the edge

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination

inputFields.name: afterCheckpoint
inputFields.description: Limit to events that occured strictly after the given checkpoint.

inputFields.name: atCheckpoint
inputFields.description: Limit to events in the given checkpoint.

inputFields.name: beforeCheckpoint
inputFields.description: Limit to event that occured strictly before the given checkpoint.

inputFields.name: sender
inputFields.description: Filter on events by transaction sender address.

inputFields.name: module
inputFields.description:
Events emitted by a particular module. An event is emitted by a particular module if some function in the module is called by a PTB and emits an event.

Modules can be filtered by their package, or package::module. We currently do not support filtering by emitting module and event type at the same time so if both are provided in one filter, the query will error.

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description:
This field is used to specify the type of event emitted.

Events can be filtered by their type's package, package::module, or their fully qualified type name.

Generic types can be queried by either the generic type name, e.g. `0x2::coin::Coin`, or by the full type name, such as `0x2::coin::Coin<0x2::sui::SUI>`.

types.name: ExecutionError
types.description: Represents execution error information for failed transactions.

fields.name: abortCode
fields.description:
The error code of the Move abort, populated if this transaction failed with a Move abort.

Returns the explicit code if the abort used `code` annotation (e.g., `abort(ERR, code = 5)` returns 5), otherwise returns the raw abort code containing encoded error information.

fields.name: sourceLineNumber
fields.description: The source line number for the abort. Only populated for clever errors.

fields.name: instructionOffset
fields.description: The instruction offset in the Move bytecode where the error occurred. Populated for Move aborts and primitive runtime errors.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: The error's name. Only populated for clever errors.

fields.name: constant
fields.description:
An associated constant for the error. Only populated for clever errors.

Constants are returned as human-readable strings when possible. Complex types are returned as Base64-encoded bytes.

fields.name: module
fields.description: The module that the abort originated from. Only populated for Move aborts and primitive runtime errors.

fields.name: function
fields.description: The function that the abort originated from. Only populated for Move aborts and primitive runtime errors that have function name information.

fields.name: message
fields.description:
Human readable explanation of why the transaction failed.

For Move aborts, the error message will be resolved to a human-readable form if possible, otherwise it will fall back to displaying the abort code and location.

types.name: ExecutionResult
types.description: The execution result of a transaction, including the transaction effects and any potential errors due to signing or quorum-driving.

fields.name: effects
fields.description: The effects of the transaction execution, if successful.

fields.name: errors
fields.description:
Errors that occurred during execution (e.g., network errors, validation failures).
These are distinct from execution failures within the transaction itself.

types.name: ExecutionStatus
types.description: The execution status of this transaction: success or failure.

enumValues.name: SUCCESS
enumValues.description: The transaction was successfully executed.

enumValues.name: FAILURE
enumValues.description: The transaction could not be executed.

types.name: FeatureFlag
types.description: A boolean protocol configuration.

fields.name: key
fields.description: Feature flag name.

fields.name: value
fields.description: Feature flag value.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: GasCoin
types.description: Access to the gas inputs, after they have been smashed into one coin. The gas coin can only be used by reference, except for with `TransferObjectsTransaction` that can accept it by value.

fields.description: Placeholder field (gas coin has no additional data)

types.name: GasCostSummary
types.description:
Summary of charges from transactions.

Storage is charged in three parts -- `storage_cost`, `-storage_rebate`, and `non_refundable_storage_fee` -- independently of `computation_cost`.

The overall cost of a transaction, deducted from its gas coins, is its `computation_cost + storage_cost - storage_rebate`. `non_refundable_storage_fee` is collected from objects being mutated or deleted and accumulated by the system in storage funds, the remaining storage costs of previous object versions are what become the `storage_rebate`. The ratio between `non_refundable_storage_fee` and `storage_rebate` is set by the protocol.

fields.name: computationCost
fields.description: The sum cost of computation/execution

fields.name: storageCost
fields.description: Cost for storage at the time the transaction is executed, calculated as the size of the objects being mutated in bytes multiplied by a storage cost per byte (part of the protocol).

fields.name: storageRebate
fields.description: Amount the user gets back from the storage cost of the previous versions of objects being mutated or deleted.

fields.name: nonRefundableStorageFee
fields.description: Amount that is retained by the system in the storage fund from the cost of the previous versions of objects being mutated or deleted.

types.name: GasEffects
types.description: Effects related to gas (costs incurred and the identity of the smashed gas object returned).

fields.name: gasObject
fields.description: The gas object used to pay for this transaction. If multiple gas coins were provided, this represents the combined coin after smashing.

fields.name: gasSummary
fields.description: Breakdown of the gas costs for this transaction.

fields.name: gasSponsor
fields.description: Address of the owner of the gas object(s) used.

fields.name: gasPrice
fields.description: An unsigned integer specifying the number of native tokens per gas unit this transaction will pay (in MIST).

fields.name: gasBudget
fields.description: The maximum SUI that can be expended by executing this transaction

fields.name: gasPayment
fields.description: Objects used to pay for a transaction's execution and storage

types.name: GenesisTransaction
types.description: System transaction that initializes the network and writes the initial set of objects on-chain.

fields.name: objects
fields.description: Objects to be created during genesis.

types.name: IAddressable
types.description:
Interface implemented by GraphQL types representing entities that are identified by an address.

An address uniquely represents either the public key of an account, or an object's ID, but never both. It is not possible to determine which type an address represents up-front. If an object is wrapped, its contents will not be accessible via its address, but it will still be possible to access other objects it owns.

fields.name: balance
fields.description:
Fetch the total balance for coins with marker type `coinType` (e.g. `0x2::sui::SUI`), owned by this address.

If the address does not own any coins of that type, a balance of zero is returned.

fields.name: balances
fields.description: Total balance across coins owned by this address, grouped by coin type.

fields.name: defaultSuinsName
fields.description: The domain explicitly configured as the default SuiNS name for this address.

fields.name: multiGetBalances
fields.description:
Fetch the total balances keyed by coin types (e.g. `0x2::sui::SUI`) owned by this address.

Returns `null` when no checkpoint is set in scope (e.g. execution scope). If the address does not own any coins of a given type, a balance of zero is returned for that type.

fields.name: objects
fields.description: Objects owned by this address, optionally filtered by type.

types.name: IMoveDatatype
types.description:
Interface implemented by all GraphQL types that represent a Move datatype definition (either a struct or an enum definition).

This interface is used to provide a way to access fields that are shared by both structs and enums, e.g., the module that the datatype belongs to, the name of the datatype, type parameters etc.

fields.name: module
fields.description: The module that this datatype is defined in

fields.name: name
fields.description: The datatype's unqualified name

fields.name: abilities
fields.description: Abilities on this datatype definition.

fields.name: typeParameters
fields.description:
Constraints on the datatype's formal type parameters

Move bytecode does not name type parameters, so when they are referenced (e.g. in field types), they are identified by their index in this list.

types.name: IMoveObject

fields.description: The structured representation of the object's contents.

Returns `null` if a dynamic field with that name could not be found attached to this object.

fields.name: dynamicObjectField
fields.description:
Access a dynamic object field on an object using its type and BCS-encoded name.

Returns `null` if a dynamic object field with that name could not be found attached to this object.

fields.name: hasPublicTransfer
fields.description:
Whether this object can be transfered using the `TransferObjects` Programmable Transaction Command or `sui::transfer::public_transfer`.

Both these operations require the object to have both the `key` and `store` abilities.

fields.name: multiGetDynamicFields

Access dynamic fields on an object using their types and BCS-encoded names.

fields.name: json

Representation of a Move value in JSON, where:

- Addresses, IDs, and UIDs are represented in canonical form, as JSON strings.
- Bools are represented by JSON boolean literals.
- u8, u16, and u32 are represented as JSON numbers.
- u64, u128, and u256 are represented as JSON strings.
- Balances, Strings, and Urls are represented as JSON strings.
- Vectors of bytes are represented as Base64 blobs, and other vectors are represented by JSON arrays.
- Structs are represented by JSON objects.
- Enums are represented by JSON objects, with a field named `@variant` containing the variant name.
- Empty optional values are represented by `null`.

fields.name: executeTransaction
fields.description:
Execute a transaction, committing its effects on chain.

- `transactionDataBcs` contains the BCS-encoded transaction data (Base64-encoded).
- `signatures` are a list of `flag || signature || pubkey` bytes, Base64-encoded.

Waits until the transaction has reached finality on chain to return its transaction digest, or returns the error that prevented finality if that was not possible. A transaction is final when its effects are guaranteed on chain (it cannot be revoked).

There may be a delay between transaction finality and when GraphQL requests (including the request that issued the transaction) reflect its effects. As a result, queries that depend on indexing the state of the chain (e.g. contents of output objects, address-level balance information at the time of the transaction), must wait for indexing to catch up by polling for the transaction digest using `Query.transaction`.

types.name: Object
types.description:
An Object on Sui is either a typed value (a Move Object) or a Package (modules containing functions and types).

Every object on Sui is identified by a unique address, and has a version number that increases with every modification. Objects also hold metadata detailing their current owner (who can sign for access to the object and whether that access can modify and/or delete the object), and the digest of the last transaction that modified the object.

types.name: ObjectFilter
types.description:
A filter over the live object set, the filter can be one of:

- A filter on type (all live objects whose type matches that filter).
- Fetching all objects owned by an address or object, optionally filtered by type.
- Fetching all shared or immutable objects, filtered by type.

inputFields.name: ownerKind
inputFields.description:
Filter on whether the object is address-owned, object-owned, shared, or immutable.

- If this field is set to "ADDRESS" or "OBJECT", then an owner filter must also be provided.
- If this field is set to "SHARED" or "IMMUTABLE", then a type filter must also be provided.

inputFields.name: owner
inputFields.description:
Specifies the address of the owning address or object.

This field is required if `ownerKind` is "ADDRESS" or "OBJECT". If provided without `ownerKind`, `ownerKind` defaults to "ADDRESS".

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description:
Filter on the object's type.

The filter can be one of:

- A package address: `0x2`,
- A module: `0x2::coin`,
- A fully-qualified name: `0x2::coin::Coin`,
- A type instantiation: `0x2::coin::Coin<0x2::sui::SUI>`.

types.name: ObjectKey
types.description:
Identifies a specific version of an object.

The `address` field must be specified, as well as at most one of `version`, `rootVersion`, or `atCheckpoint`. If none are provided, the object is fetched at the current checkpoint.

Specifying a `version` or a `rootVersion` disables nested queries for paginating owned objects or dynamic fields (these queries are only supported at checkpoint boundaries).

See `Query.object` for more details.

inputFields.name: address
inputFields.description: The object's ID.

inputFields.name: version
inputFields.description: If specified, tries to fetch the object at this exact version.

inputFields.name: rootVersion
inputFields.description:
If specified, tries to fetch the latest version of the object at or before this version. Nested dynamic field accesses will also be subject to this bound.

This can be used to fetch a child or ancestor object bounded by its root object's version. For any wrapped or child (object-owned) object, its root object can be defined recursively as:

- The root object of the object it is wrapped in, if it is wrapped.
- The root object of its owner, if it is owned by another object.
- The object itself, if it is not object-owned or wrapped.

inputFields.name: atCheckpoint
inputFields.description: If specified, tries to fetch the latest version as of this checkpoint. Fails if the checkpoint is later than the RPC's latest checkpoint.

types.description: BCS encoded primitive value (not an object or Move struct).

fields.description: BCS serialized and Base64 encoded primitive value.

fields.name: address
fields.description:
Look-up an account by its SuiAddress.

If `rootVersion` is specified, nested dynamic field accesses will be fetched at or before this version. This can be used to fetch a child or ancestor object bounded by its root object's version, when its immediate parent is wrapped, or a value in a dynamic object field. For any wrapped or child (object-owned) object, its root object can be defined recursively as:

- The root object of the object it is wrapped in, if it is wrapped.
- The root object of its owner, if it is owned by another object.
- The object itself, if it is not object-owned or wrapped.

Specifying a `rootVersion` disables nested queries for paginating owned objects or dynamic fields (these queries are only supported at checkpoint boundaries).

fields.name: chainIdentifier
fields.description: First four bytes of the network's genesis checkpoint digest (uniquely identifies the network), hex-encoded.

fields.name: checkpoint
fields.description:
Fetch a checkpoint by its sequence number, or the latest checkpoint if no sequence number is provided.

Returns `null` if the checkpoint does not exist in the store, either because it never existed or because it was pruned.

fields.name: checkpoints
fields.description: Paginate checkpoints in the network, optionally bounded to checkpoints in the given epoch.

fields.name: coinMetadata
fields.description:
Fetch the CoinMetadata for a given coin type.

Returns `null` if no CoinMetadata object exists for the given coin type.

fields.name: epoch
fields.description:
Fetch an epoch by its ID, or fetch the latest epoch if no ID is provided.

Returns `null` if the epoch does not exist yet, or was pruned.

fields.name: epochs
fields.description: Paginate epochs that are in the network.

fields.name: events
fields.description: Paginate events that are emitted in the network, optionally filtered by event filters.

fields.name: multiGetCheckpoints
fields.description:
Fetch checkpoints by their sequence numbers.

Returns a list of checkpoints that is guaranteed to be the same length as `keys`. If a checkpoint in `keys` could not be found in the store, its corresponding entry in the result will be `null`. This could be because the checkpoint does not exist yet, or because it was pruned.

fields.name: multiGetEpochs
fields.description:
Fetch epochs by their IDs.

Returns a list of epochs that is guaranteed to be the same length as `keys`. If an epoch in `keys` could not be found in the store, its corresponding entry in the result will be `null`. This could be because the epoch does not exist yet, or because it was pruned.

fields.name: multiGetObjects
fields.description:
Fetch objects by their keys.

Returns a list of objects that is guaranteed to be the same length as `keys`. If an object in `keys` could not be found in the store, its corresponding entry in the result will be `null`. This could be because the object never existed, or because it was pruned.

fields.name: multiGetPackages
fields.description:
Fetch packages by their keys.

Returns a list of packages that is guaranteed to be the same length as `keys`. If a package in `keys` could not be found in the store, its corresponding entry in the result will be `null`. This could be because that address never pointed to a package, or because the package was pruned.

fields.name: multiGetTransactions
fields.description:
Fetch transactions by their digests.

Returns a list of transactions that is guaranteed to be the same length as `keys`. If a digest in `keys` could not be found in the store, its corresponding entry in the result will be `null`. This could be because the transaction never existed, or because it was pruned.

fields.name: multiGetTransactionEffects
fields.description:
Fetch transaction effects by their transactions' digests.

Returns a list of transaction effects that is guaranteed to be the same length as `keys`. If a digest in `keys` could not be found in the store, its corresponding entry in the result will be `null`. This could be because the transaction effects never existed, or because it was pruned.

fields.name: multiGetTypes
fields.description:
Fetch types by their string representations.

Types are canonicalized: In the input they can be at any package address at or after the package that first defines them, and in the output they will be relocated to the package that first defines them.

Returns a list of types that is guaranteed to be the same length as `keys`. If a type in `keys` could not be found, its corresponding entry in the result will be `null`.

fields.name: object
fields.description:
Fetch an object by its address.

If `version` is specified, the object will be fetched at that exact version.

If `rootVersion` is specified, the object will be fetched at the latest version at or before this version. Nested dynamic field accesses will also be subject to this bound. This can be used to fetch a child or ancestor object bounded by its root object's version. For any wrapped or child (object-owned) object, its root object can be defined recursively as:

- The root object of the object it is wrapped in, if it is wrapped.
- The root object of its owner, if it is owned by another object.
- The object itself, if it is not object-owned or wrapped.

Specifying a `version` or a `rootVersion` disables nested queries for paginating owned objects or dynamic fields (these queries are only supported at checkpoint boundaries).

If `atCheckpoint` is specified, the object will be fetched at the latest version as of this checkpoint. This will fail if the provided checkpoint is after the RPC's latest checkpoint.

If none of the above are specified, the object is fetched at the latest checkpoint.

It is an error to specify more than one of `version`, `rootVersion`, or `atCheckpoint`.

Returns `null` if an object cannot be found that meets this criteria.

fields.name: objects
fields.description:
Paginate objects in the live object set, optionally filtered by owner and/or type. `filter` can be one of:

- A filter on type (all live objects whose type matches that filter).
- Fetching all objects owned by an address or object, optionally filtered by type.
- Fetching all shared or immutable objects, filtered by type.

fields.name: objectVersions
fields.description: Paginate all versions of an object at `address`, optionally bounding the versions exclusively from below with `filter.afterVersion` or from above with `filter.beforeVersion`.

fields.name: package
fields.description:
Fetch a package by its address.

If `version` is specified, the package loaded is the one that shares its original ID with the package at `address`, but whose version is `version`.

If `atCheckpoint` is specified, the package loaded is the one with the largest version among all packages sharing an original ID with the package at `address` and was published at or before `atCheckpoint`.

If neither are specified, the package is fetched at the latest checkpoint.

It is an error to specify both `version` and `atCheckpoint`, and `null` will be returned if the package cannot be found as of the latest checkpoint, or the address points to an object that is not a package.

Note that this interpretation of `version` and "latest" differs from the one used by `Query.object`, because non-system package upgrades generate objects with different IDs. To fetch a package using the versioning semantics of objects, use `Object.asMovePackage` nested under `Query.object`.

fields.name: packages
fields.description: Paginate all packages published on-chain, optionally bounded to packages published strictly after `filter.afterCheckpoint` and/or strictly before `filter.beforeCheckpoint`.

fields.name: packageVersions
fields.description:
Paginate all versions of a package at `address`, optionally bounding the versions exclusively from below with `filter.afterVersion` or from above with `filter.beforeVersion`.

Different versions of a package will have different object IDs, unless they are system packages, but will share the same original ID.

fields.name: protocolConfigs
fields.description: Fetch the protocol config by protocol version, or the latest protocol config used on chain if no version is provided.

fields.name: serviceConfig
fields.description: Configuration for this RPC service.

fields.name: suinsName
fields.description: Look-up an account by its SuiNS name, assuming it has a valid, unexpired name registration.

fields.name: transaction
fields.description:
Fetch a transaction by its digest.

Returns `null` if the transaction does not exist in the store, either because it never existed or because it was pruned.

fields.name: transactionEffects
fields.description:
Fetch transaction effects by its transaction's digest.

Returns `null` if the transaction effects do not exist in the store, either because that transaction was not executed, or it was pruned.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: The transactions that exist in the network, optionally filtered by transaction filters.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Fetch a structured representation of a concrete type, including its layout information.

Types are canonicalized: In the input they can be at any package address at or after the package that first defines them, and in the output they will be relocated to the package that first defines them.

Fails if the type is malformed, returns `null` if a type mentioned does not exist.

fields.name: simulateTransaction
fields.description:
Simulate a transaction to preview its effects without executing it on chain.

Accepts a JSON transaction matching the [Sui gRPC API schema](https://docs.sui.io/references/fullnode-protocol#sui-rpc-v2-Transaction).
The JSON format allows for partial transaction specification where certain fields can be automatically resolved by the server.

Alternatively, for already serialized transactions, you can pass BCS-encoded data:
`{"bcs": {"value": "<base64>"}}`

Unlike `executeTransaction`, this does not require signatures since the transaction is not committed to the blockchain. This allows for previewing transaction effects, estimating gas costs, and testing transaction logic without spending gas or requiring valid signatures.

- `checksEnabled`: If true, enables transaction validation checks during simulation. Defaults to true.
- `doGasSelection`: If true, enables automatic gas coin selection and budget estimation. Defaults to false.

fields.name: verifyZkLoginSignature
fields.description:
Verify a zkLogin signature os from the given `author`.

Returns a `ZkLoginVerifyResult` where `success` is `true` and `error` is empty if the signature is valid. If the signature is invalid, `success` is `false` and `error` contains the relevant error message.

- `bytes` are either the bytes of a serialized personal message, or `TransactionData`, Base64-encoded.
- `signature` is a serialized zkLogin signature, also Base64-encoded.
- `intentScope` indicates whether `bytes` are to be parsed as a personal message or `TransactionData`.
- `author` is the signer's address.

types.description: System transaction for creating the on-chain randomness state.

fields.description: A workaround to define an empty variant of a GraphQL union.

types.name: RandomnessStateUpdateTransaction

fields.name: randomnessRound

fields.name: randomBytes
fields.description: Updated random bytes, Base64 encoded.

fields.name: randomnessObjInitialSharedVersion
fields.description: The initial version of the randomness object that it was shared at.

types.name: ReadConsensusStreamEnded
types.description: A transaction that wanted to read a consensus-managed object but couldn't because it became not-consensus-managed before the transaction executed (for example, it was deleted, turned into an owned object, or wrapped).

fields.name: address
fields.description: The ID of the consensus-managed object.

fields.name: sequenceNumber
fields.description: The sequence number associated with the consensus stream ending.

types.name: Receiving
types.description: A Move object that can be received in this transaction.

types.name: RegulatedState

fields.name: enabled
fields.description:
Whether safe mode was used for the last epoch change.
The system will retry a full epoch change on every epoch boundary and automatically reset this flag if so.

fields.name: gasSummary
fields.description: Accumulated fees for computation and cost that have not been added to the various reward pools, because the full epoch change did not happen.

fields.name: mutationTimeoutMs
fields.description: Maximum time in milliseconds spent waiting for a response from fullnode after issuing a transaction to execute. Note that the transaction may still succeed even in the case of a timeout. Transactions are idempotent, so a transaction that times out should be re-submitted until the network returns a definite response (success or failure, not timeout).

fields.name: queryTimeoutMs
fields.description: Maximum time in milliseconds that will be spent to serve one query request.

fields.name: maxQueryDepth
fields.description: Maximum depth of a GraphQL query that can be accepted by this service.

fields.name: maxQueryNodes
fields.description: The maximum number of nodes (field names) the service will accept in a single query.

fields.name: maxOutputNodes
fields.description:
Maximum number of estimated output nodes in a GraphQL response.

The estimate is an upperbound of how many nodes there would be in the output assuming every requested field is present, paginated requests return full page sizes, and multi-get queries find all requested keys. Below is a worked example query:

```graphql
|  0: query {                            # 514 = total
|  1:   checkpoint {                     # 1
|  2:     sequenceNumber                 # 1
|  3:   }
|  4:
|  5:   multiGetObjects([$a, $b, $c]) {  # 1 (* 3)
|  6:     address                        # 3
|  7:     digest                         # 3
|  8:   }
|  9:
| 10:   # default page size is 20
| 11:   transactions {                   # 1 (* 20)
| 12:     pageInfo {                     # 1
| 13:       hasNextPage                  # 1
| 14:       endCursor                    # 1
| 15:     }
| 16:
| 17:     nodes                          # 1
| 18:     {                              # 20
| 19:       digest                       # 20
| 20:       effects {                    # 20
| 21:         objectChanges(first: 10) { # 20 (* 10)
| 22:           nodes                    # 20
| 23:           {                        # 200
| 24:             address                # 200
| 25:           }
| 26:         }
| 27:       }
| 28:     }
| 29:   }
| 30: }
```

fields.name: maxTransactionPayloadSize
fields.description:
Maximum size in bytes allowed for the `txBytes` and `signatures` parameters of an `executeTransaction` or `simulateTransaction` field, or the `bytes` and `signature` parameters of a `verifyZkLoginSignature` field.

This is cumulative across all matching fields in a single GraphQL request.

fields.name: maxQueryPayloadSize
fields.description: Maximum size in bytes of a single GraphQL request, excluding the elements covered by `maxTransactionPayloadSize`.

fields.name: defaultPageSize
fields.description:
Number of elements a paginated connection will return if a page size is not supplied.

Accepts `type` and `field` arguments which identify the connection that is being queried. If the field in question is paginated, its default page size is returned. If it does not exist or is not paginated, `null` is returned.

fields.name: maxPageSize
fields.description:
Maximum number of elements that can be requested from a paginated connection. A request to fetch more elements will result in an error.

Accepts `type` and `field` arguments which identify the connection that is being queried. If the field in question is paginated, its max page size is returned. If it does not exist or is not paginated, `null` is returned.

fields.name: maxMultiGetSize
fields.description: Maximum number of elements that can be requested from a multi-get query. A request to fetch more keys will result in an error.

fields.name: maxTypeArgumentDepth
fields.description: Maximum amount of nesting among type arguments (type arguments nest when a type argument is itself generic and has arguments).

fields.name: maxTypeArgumentWidth
fields.description: Maximum number of type parameters a type can have.

fields.name: maxTypeNodes
fields.description: Maximum number of datatypes that need to be processed when calculating the layout of a single type.

fields.name: maxMoveValueDepth
fields.description: Maximum nesting allowed in datatype fields when calculating the layout of a single type.

fields.name: maxMoveValueBound
fields.description: Maximum budget in bytes to spend when outputting a structured `MoveValue`.

fields.name: maxDisplayFieldDepth
fields.description: Maximum depth of nested field access supported in display outputs.

fields.name: maxDisplayOutputSize
fields.description: Maximum output size of a display output.

fields.name: maxDisassembledModuleSize
fields.description: Maximum output size of a disassembled MoveModule, in bytes.

fields.name: availableRange
fields.description: Range of checkpoints for which data is available for a query type, field and optional filter. If filter is not provided, the strictest retention range for the query and type is returned.

types.name: Shared
types.description: Object is shared, can be used by any address, and is mutable.

fields.name: initialSharedVersion
fields.description: The version at which the object became shared.

types.name: SharedInput
types.description: A Move object that's shared.

fields.name: address
fields.description: The address of the shared object.

fields.name: initialSharedVersion
fields.description: The version that this object was shared at.

fields.name: mutable
fields.description:
Controls whether the transaction block can reference the shared object as a mutable reference or by value.

This has implications for scheduling: Transactions that just read shared objects at a certain version (mutable = false) can be executed concurrently, while transactions that write shared objects (mutable = true) must be executed serially with respect to each other.

Error message if the simulation failed.

`None` if the simulation was successful.

fields.description:
Number of times stake subsidies have been distributed.
Subsidies are distributed with other staking rewards, at the end of the epoch.

fields.name: currentDistributionAmount
fields.description: Amount of stake subsidy deducted from the balance per distribution -- decays over time.

fields.name: periodLength
fields.description: Maximum number of stake subsidy distributions that occur with the same distribution amount (before the amount is reduced).

fields.name: decreaseRate

types.name: StorageFund
types.description: SUI set aside to account for objects stored on-chain.

fields.name: totalObjectStorageRebates
fields.description: Sum of storage rebates of live objects on chain.

fields.name: nonRefundableBalance
fields.description:
The portion of the storage fund that will never be refunded through storage rebates.
The system maintains an invariant that the sum of all storage fees into the storage fund is equal to the sum of all storage rebates out, the total storage rebates remaining, and the non-refundable balance.

The object could have been created, read, modified, deleted, wrapped, or unwrapped by the transaction.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type
validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution
behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally
including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing
additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description:
A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a
__DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION

enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description:
One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a
placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned
in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description:
Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which
has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description:
Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an
InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and
optionally a default value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description:
A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes
all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry
points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description:
If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will
be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description:
If this server support subscription, the type that subscription
operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds
of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about
that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and
description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface
types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface,
provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose
other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description:
Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid
fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description:
Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are
valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.
